{{also|台湾|台灣}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=台湾|t2=台灣}}

===Etymology===
Officially, no later than 1684 with the creation of {{w|Taiwan Prefecture}} ({{w2|zh|臺灣府}}). A phonetic transliteration of an ethnonym of a tribe in the southwest part of the island in the area of [[Anping]], [[Tainan]], recorded in Dutch records as "Tayowan" (and other variants), and in Chinese characters as "{{zh-l|*臺窩灣}}" (and variants {{zh-l|*大員}}, {{zh-l|*大圓}}, {{zh-l|*臺員}}, {{zh-l|*臺圓}}). A Dutch missionary referred to this group as ''Taiouwang'' no later than 1636.

Possibily derived from {{der|zh|fos|tayw||[[man]]}} and {{m|fos|an||[[place]]}}.

====Usage notes====
* Although use of the full traditional form {{zh-l|*臺}} is encouraged by the ROC Ministry of Education, the alternate traditional form {{zh-l|*台}} is now more commonly used in its place.<ref>{{cite-journal |author=Shih Hsiu-chuan |title=Premier respects ‘choice’ on spelling |url=http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/taiwan/archives/2010/12/14/2003490913 |accessdate=8 Jan 2015|date=14 Dec 2010 |work=Taipei Times}}</ref>
